column5: I was wondering are steelhead eggs as good to use as salmon eggs for roe? Also does anyone have a simple but good way to cure them

I find them better....and what I do is just water harden them in the water you got the fish from.....the water is usually cold enough to harden them...keep in a bag for rinse them off and drain water...then put more stream water in there and leave for like 10-15 minutes...thats all I do!
If you cant do it streamside, then I find that really cold distilled water works great for hardening them too.  I use only steelie roe to catch them...mind you, I'm not that good at it....LOL
I still find that when I get into say late April and most of may.....I get more fish on a single small yarn egg.
if you want steelie roe cured just got buy it at a tackle shop!!! why waste good fresh roe from a fish!!!! fresh roe will out perform cured roe any day of the week!!!
